title: Public Records Request – Arrest Incident Summaries (Sept-Nov 2024)

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request – Arrest Incident Summaries (Sept-Nov 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting incident summaries for all arrests made by the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department between September 1, 2024, and November 30, 2024.

I am specifically requesting:

Suspect Name
Suspect Date of Birth
Date & Time of Incident
Address
Case Number
Officers Involved
Type of Incident/Arrest Charge
Brief Summary of Events (excluding sensitive or restricted details)
Disposition (if available, such as “suspect booked” or “case referred to DA”)
I do not require any personally identifiable information of victims, minors, or witnesses.

If this request is too broad, please provide records for a shorter period or let me know how it can be refined to comply with your records policies. I am willing to pay any reasonable processing fees; however, I request an estimate before incurring any costs.

Please let me know if this request can be fulfilled electronically via email or online portal. If the records are not available in summary form, I would appreciate guidance on how to access publicly available arrest logs.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Child care provider data

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Child care provider data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16)	Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17)	Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18)	Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

title: Sen. Hughes and Rep. Toth correspondence with Jonathan Mitchell

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Sen. Hughes and Rep. Toth correspondence with Jonathan Mitchell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any digital communications (including but not limited to: emails, text messages, engagement letters) between Texas state Senator Bryan Hughes and Jonathan Mitchell and/or Mitchell Law PLLC (jonathan@mitchell.law) sent between November 1, 2024, and the time this request is processed, including attachments

- Any digital communications (including but not limited to: emails, text messages, engagement letters) between Texas state Representative Steve Toth and Jonathan Mitchell and/or Mitchell Law PLLC (jonathan@mitchell.law) sent between November 1, 2024, and the time this request is processed, including attachments

This session, lawmakers Hughes and Toth have introduced abortion-related bills with civil liability enforcement provisions that mirror a 2021 law written by Jonathan Mitchell.

I am a journalist doing public interest reporting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Susan Rinkunas

title: Records pertaining to contracts and arrangements involving airplane companies and private security firms for deportation operations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records pertaining to contracts and arrangements involving airplane companies and private security firms for deportation operations
communications.communication:
Jordan Lassiter
Investigative Journalist
March 12, 2025

U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement
Enforcement and Removal Operations (ERO) FOIA Office
500 12th Street SW
Washington, DC 20536
Email: ICE-FOIA@dhs.gov
Fax: (202) 732-4265

CRITICAL NOTICE – READ CAREFULLY – COMPREHENSIVE COMPLIANCE REQUIRED

This FOIA request contains legally binding instructions that must be followed in their entirety. Failure to comply with any portion—including the detailed search methodology, records preservation directives, or production requirements—will be construed as noncompliance under 5 U.S.C. § 552 and may result in immediate legal action.

SUBJECT:
REQUEST FOR ALL Records pertaining to contracts and arrangements involving airplane companies and private security firms for deportation operations
(Focus: Records from January 1, 2018 to Present, with particular emphasis on documents generated during Trump’s first and current presidencies.)

I. INTRODUCTION & SCOPE

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and applicable agency regulations, I hereby request access to and copies of all records, contracts, memoranda, agreements, proposals, directives, and communications regarding ICE’s engagements with:

AIRPLANE COMPANIES

All records (contracts, amendments, proposals, and related communications) between ICE (and its subordinate components) and airplane companies utilized to charter deportation flights.
Context: Investigative reports, such as the University of Washington article “ICE, Air, and Deportation: The King County Case” (https://jsis.washington.edu/humanrights/2019/04/23/ice-air-king-county/), detail ICE’s use of charter flights in deportation efforts.
Legal Precedents:
• Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989)
• Milner v. Department of Navy, 562 U.S. 562 (2011)
PRIVATE SECURITY FIRMS

All records involving contracts, agreements, and related communications between ICE (and its sub-offices) and private security companies that provide operational support (e.g., ground escorts, logistical services) during deportation operations.
Legal Precedents:
• Electronic Privacy Information Center v. Department of Justice, 416 F. Supp. 2d 30 (D.D.C. 2006)
• Judicial Watch, Inc. v. U.S. Department of Defense, 857 F. Supp. 2d 44 (D.D.C. 2012)
Additional Reporting: See “ICE contractor flight to Seattle may signal Washington state detention center will fill up” (The Spokesman-Review, Feb. 5, 2025).
Time Frame & Focus on Trump’s Presidencies:
This request covers all responsive records from January 1, 2018 through the present. For the purposes of this request:

"Trump’s first presidency" refers to his time in office from January 20, 2017 through January 20, 2021. Since the requested records begin on January 1, 2018, this period will cover records generated during the majority of his first term.
"Trump’s current presidency" refers to his second term, which began on January 20, 2025, and continues to the present.
II. DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS REQUESTED

To ensure full compliance and eliminate ambiguity, please produce all responsive documents, including but not limited to:

A. Contracts & Agreements

All executed contracts, amendments, proposals, and related communications between ICE (and its sub-offices) and:
Airplane companies used to operate deportation flights.
Private security firms providing additional operational support services.
B. Communications & Internal Directives

All internal communications (emails, instant messages, memos, briefing documents, meeting minutes, and draft versions) among ICE officials regarding:
The contracting process and oversight of deportation flight arrangements.
Evaluation, modifications, and performance assessments of such contracts.
C. Policy Documents & Operational Guidelines

All finalized or draft policy documents, guidelines, or standard operating procedures that authorize or regulate:
The engagement of external contractors (both airplane companies and private security firms) for deportation operations.
Oversight and performance evaluation of these contracted services.
D. Search Methodology Documentation

A detailed account of the search strategies used to identify responsive records, including:
• The systems and databases searched (e.g., ICE’s electronic records management systems, contract databases, email servers).
• Search terms, date ranges, custodians, and personnel involved.
• Complete search logs and documentation verifying that all relevant systems were thoroughly searched.
III. CUSTODIANS & SYSTEMS

Please search all relevant ICE components and sub-offices, including but not limited to:
• ICE Headquarters and Regional Offices
• ICE’s Office of Detention and Removal
• ICE’s Contracting, Procurement, and related administrative divisions

Systems to be searched include:
• Electronic records management and email systems
• Contract and document management platforms
• Digital repositories or archives where such contracts and communications are stored

IV. LEGAL AUTHORITIES & PRECEDENTS

This request is substantiated by established FOIA precedent and the public’s right to know, including:
• Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989)
• Milner v. Department of Navy, 562 U.S. 562 (2011)
• Electronic Privacy Information Center v. Department of Justice, 416 F. Supp. 2d 30 (D.D.C. 2006)
• Judicial Watch, Inc. v. U.S. Department of Defense, 857 F. Supp. 2d 44 (D.D.C. 2012)

V. EXPEDITED PROCESSING & FEE WAIVER

Due to the significant public interest in ensuring transparency regarding ICE’s contracting practices related to deportation operations—and in light of the policies enacted during both of Trump’s presidencies—I request expedited processing pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II). Furthermore, I request a complete waiver of fees under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii) on the basis that disclosure of these records will substantially contribute to public understanding of ICE operations and accountability in government contracting.

VI. FORMAT OF PRODUCTION

Please produce all responsive records in their native electronic formats with full metadata intact. This includes:
• Emails and documents in their native file formats (e.g., .MSG, .EML, .DOCX, .PDF, etc.).
• Structured data in searchable electronic formats (e.g., .CSV, .XML) along with any accompanying data dictionaries.
• Search documentation provided in a verifiable electronic format.

For any records that exist solely in paper form, please provide high-resolution scanned copies (minimum 300 dpi) in PDF format.

VII. PRESERVATION & ADMINISTRATIVE TRACKING

Until a final determination on this request is rendered, please ensure that all responsive records are preserved in their entirety, including all associated metadata. In addition, please provide:
• The tracking number assigned to this request.
• The names and titles of the FOIA officers handling this request.
• Detailed documentation of the search methodologies employed.

VIII. RIGHT TO APPEAL & STATUTORY DEADLINES

I expressly reserve the right to appeal any adverse determination, including denials of expedited processing, fee waiver, or inadequacies in the search. I expect a determination on this request within 20 working days (or 10 calendar days if expedited processing applies) as mandated by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i).

IX. FINAL WARNING & DISCLAIMER

YOU ARE HEREBY NOTIFIED:
Any failure to comply with these detailed instructions—including conducting a comprehensive search across all relevant systems and custodians—will be deemed noncompliance with FOIA obligations and may serve as grounds for immediate judicial review and legal action pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(B) and related case law.

Please acknowledge receipt of this request and provide the assigned tracking number within five (5) working days. For any clarifications, contact me immediately rather than resorting to delay tactics.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter
Investigative Journalist

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)

• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

title: police brutality investigation

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: police brutality investigation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following:

Employment Status Confirmation: If Officer Edgar I. De Hoyos has never made an arrest, please provide a sworn statement confirming his current employment status and exact dates of service with the McAllen Police Department, from his hire date of September 26, 2022, to the present (March 17, 2025).
Arrest Reports: If Officer De Hoyos has made arrests, provide all arrest reports from September 26, 2022, to March 17, 2025, where he is listed as the arresting officer, including:
Report number
Date of arrest
Charges filed
Name of the individual arrested
Please note that records for cases no longer under active investigation are not exempt under TPIA and must be disclosed.
Disciplinary Records: All disciplinary records, internal affairs investigations, reprimands, and citizen complaints involving Officer Edgar I. De Hoyos, from September 26, 2022, to March 17, 2025, including:
Dates of incidents
Summaries of allegations
Resolutions or outcomes
If these records are held by the Civil Service Office per your prior referral, please coordinate with that office to fulfill this request or provide their direct contact for a separate submission.
This request pertains to existing records only, as required under TPIA. Given Officer De Hoyos’ documented role as a Police Officer III in the Tactical Patrol Unit (effective September 9, 2024), it is implausible that no arrest records exist after over two years of service. Be advised that this is part of a broader, ongoing investigation into potential misconduct specifically police brutality, and any failure to comply fully with TPIA may result in escalation to the Texas Attorney General’s Office for review.

If any portion of this request is deemed exempt, please cite the specific TPIA exemption and provide non-exempt portions as required by law. If a determination from the Texas Attorney General is sought, please provide a copy of that request and the subsequent ruling. I expect a response within 10 business days, per TPIA §552.221.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David

communications.communication:

title: Georgia Open Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Incident Involving Marcel T. on June 3, 2021

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Georgia Open Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Incident Involving Marcel T. on June 3, 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records related to the incident involving Marcel T., 28, on June 3, 2021, in Atlanta, Georgia. The incident occurred during a nighttime traffic stop for a broken taillight, during which Mr. T. attempted to flee, resulting in an officer being dragged alongside the moving minivan for approximately 50 yards before breaking free. The officer sustained cuts and a broken wrist. The suspect was subsequently apprehended at gunpoint after a pursuit.

Incident Details:

Date: June 3, 2021
Location: Atlanta, Georgia
Individual: Marcel T., 28
Summary: During a traffic stop for a broken taillight, Mr. T. attempted to flee while an officer's arm was caught in the vehicle's window, dragging the officer approximately 50 yards. The officer sustained injuries, including cuts and a broken wrist. Following a pursuit, Mr. T. was apprehended at gunpoint and claimed he panicked.
Requested Records:

Body-Worn Camera Footage:

All video and audio recordings from officers present during the incident, from the initiation of the traffic stop to the conclusion of the encounter.
Footage capturing the interaction between the officer and Mr. T., including the moment the officer was dragged and the subsequent apprehension.
Dash Camera Footage:

Any available recordings from patrol vehicles at the scene, particularly those capturing the initial traffic stop, the dragging incident, and the pursuit.
Incident and Arrest Reports:

Complete incident reports detailing the events leading to Mr. T.'s arrest.
Arrest reports and any supplementary narratives by responding officers.
Use of Force Reports:

Documentation of any use of force by officers during the incident, including justifications and assessments.
911 Call Records:

Any available dispatch audio or transcripts related to the police response.
Fee Waiver Request: The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making the information publicly accessible. I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from its dissemination; if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance, and let me know if fees can be reduced or eliminated by removing specific items from the request, specifying which if so.

Please provide the requested records in electronic format, if available. If any records are withheld or redacted, kindly specify the reasons and the applicable exemptions under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within the timeframe prescribed by the Georgia Open Records Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Freedom of Information Law Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrests of Kitsie B. and Family in September 2022

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Freedom of Information Law Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrests of Kitsie B. and Family in September 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request access to records related to the arrests of Kitsie B. (38) and her three teenage children in September 2022 in Hudson, New York. The incident involved a live-streamed confrontation outside their residence, resulting in charges including inciting a riot and resisting arrest.

Incident Details:
Date: September 2022
Location: Hudson, New York
Individuals: Kitsie B. (38) and her three teenage children
Summary: Following a social media post about a dispute that drew police attention, body-worn camera footage reportedly shows Ms. B. confronting officers outside her home, asserting property rights, while her children physically intervened. Officers subsequently subdued and arrested the family members, with Ms. B. charged with inciting a riot and resisting arrest. The incident was live-streamed online, capturing the chaotic scene.
Requested Records:
Body-Worn Camera Footage:

All video and audio recordings from officers present during the incident, from arrival at the scene to the conclusion of the encounter.
Footage capturing interactions between officers, Ms. B., her children, and any bystanders.
Social Media Livestream Video:

Any copies, recordings, or archived versions of the livestreamed video captured by Ms. B. or her family members, if obtained by police as evidence.
Any analysis, reports, or documentation regarding the livestream’s role in the investigation and arrests.
Incident and Arrest Reports:

Complete incident reports detailing the events leading to the arrests of Ms. B. and her children.
Arrest reports and any supplementary narratives by responding officers.
Use of Force Reports:

Any photographs taken at the scene, including evidence of injuries, property damage, or other relevant visuals.
911 Call Records:

Any available dispatch audio or transcripts related to the police response.
Fee Waiver Request:
The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making the information publicly accessible. I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from its dissemination; if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance, and let me know if fees can be reduced or eliminated by removing specific items from the request, specifying which if so.

Please provide the requested records in electronic format, if available. If any records are withheld or redacted, kindly specify the reasons and the applicable exemptions under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within five business days, as stipulated by the New York FOIL.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Georgia Open Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrest of Unidentified Woman on August 2023

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Georgia Open Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrest of Unidentified Woman on August 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records related to the arrest of an unidentified woman in August 2023 in a mall parking lot in Atlanta, Georgia. The incident involved a public disturbance following a minor fender-bender, resulting in charges of disorderly conduct.

Incident Details:

Date: August 2023
Location: Mall parking lot, Atlanta, Georgia
Individual: Unidentified woman
Summary: Following a minor vehicle collision in a crowded mall parking lot, the woman became verbally aggressive, shouting at bystanders and calling 911 over a scratched SUV. Upon arrival, officers' body-worn cameras captured her screaming obscenities and refusing to calm down. She demanded that police arrest the other driver; however, due to her disruptive behavior, she was arrested for disorderly conduct. This incident exemplifies a public outburst over a minor incident.
Requested Records:

Body-Worn Camera Footage:

All video and audio recordings from officers present during the incident, from arrival at the scene to the conclusion of the encounter.
Footage capturing interactions between officers, the involved individuals, and bystanders.
Dash Camera Footage:

Any available recordings from patrol vehicles at the scene, particularly those capturing the initial response and interactions.
Incident and Arrest Reports:

Complete incident reports detailing the events leading to the woman's arrest.
Arrest reports and any supplementary narratives by responding officers.
911 Call Records:

Audio recordings and transcripts of any emergency calls related to this incident, including the call made by the woman reporting the fender-bender.

Fee Waiver Request: The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making the information publicly accessible. I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from its dissemination; if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance, and let me know if fees can be reduced or eliminated by removing specific items from the request, specifying which if so.

Please provide the requested records in electronic format, if available. If any records are withheld or redacted, kindly specify the reasons and the applicable exemptions under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within the timeframe prescribed by the Georgia Open Records Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Bodycam Footage and Related Records from Undercover Porch Pirate Sting (Feb. 20, 2023)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Bodycam Footage and Related Records from Undercover Porch Pirate Sting (Feb. 20, 2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records related to an undercover porch pirate sting conducted by Detective Luis Q. of the Tampa Police Department on February 20, 2023, in Tampa, Florida. The operation involved the detective posing as a DoorDash delivery driver to catch a known package thief, with the arrest captured on body-worn camera footage.

Incident Details:
Date: February 20, 2023
Location: Tampa, Florida 
Officer: Detective Luis Q. (Tampa PD)
Operation: Undercover sting targeting a package theft suspect
Summary: In response to a series of package thefts, Det. Luis went undercover dressed as a DoorDash driver. Using a decoy package equipped with a tracker, he waited in an unmarked van in a high-theft area. When a known porch pirate attempted to steal the package, Det. Luis apprehended the suspect alone. The suspect was found with dozens of stolen packages in their vehicle. The arrest was captured on body-worn camera footage and praised as a strategic and effective takedown of a package theft ring.
Requested Records:
Body-Worn Camera Footage:

All video and audio recordings from Detective Luis Q. and any other responding officers related to the undercover operation.
Footage capturing the moment the suspect attempted to steal the package and their subsequent apprehension.
Any footage showing the recovery of stolen packages.
Dash Camera Footage:

Any available in-car camera recordings from unmarked or marked police vehicles involved in the operation.
Incident and Arrest Reports:

The full police report detailing the sting operation and subsequent arrest.
Supplementary reports from any assisting officers or units.
Photographs:

Any images taken at the scene, including photos of the decoy package, the suspect’s vehicle, and recovered stolen items.
Surveillance or Third-Party Footage:

Any surveillance footage collected as evidence, such as home security footage from affected residents.
911 Call or Radio Dispatch Logs:

Any radio communication or emergency call records related to the operation.
Fee Waiver Request:
The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making the footage and related records publicly accessible. I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from its dissemination; if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance, and let me know if fees can be reduced or eliminated by removing specific items from the request, specifying which if so.

Please provide the requested records in electronic format, if available. If any records are withheld or redacted, kindly specify the reasons and the applicable exemptions under the law.

Thank you for your assistance. I look forward to your response within the timeframe prescribed by Florida Public Records Law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrest of a 15-Year-Old Male Student at Bartow High School (September 2021)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrest of a 15-Year-Old Male Student at Bartow High School (September 2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records related to the arrest of a 15-year-old male student at Bartow High School in September 2021. The incident involved the student allegedly vandalizing a school bathroom by removing two soap dispensers as part of the "devious licks" TikTok challenge.

Incident Details:
Date: September 2021
Location: Bartow High School, Bartow, Florida
Individual: 15-year-old male student
Summary: The student allegedly participated in the "devious licks" TikTok trend by removing two soap dispensers from a school bathroom wall. He reportedly posted a video online bragging about the act. Upon investigation, Bartow Police Department officers identified and arrested the student, who admitted to the vandalism, stating he did it to appear "cool" on social media. He was charged with criminal mischief and theft. (clickorlando.com)
Requested Records:
Body-Worn Camera Footage:

All video and audio recordings from responding officers during the initial call and investigation.
Footage documenting the officer's arrival at Bartow High School.
Footage capturing interviews with the suspect and any witnesses.
Any footage of the student admitting to the vandalism or interacting with officers.
Dash Camera Footage:

Any available footage capturing the student's transport, if applicable.
Incident and Arrest Reports:

Complete incident reports detailing the events leading to the student's arrest.
Arrest reports and any supplementary narratives by responding officers.
911 Call Records:

Audio recordings and transcripts of any calls related to the incident.
Photographs:

Any images taken at the scene, including evidence of property damage.
Surveillance Footage:

Copies of any surveillance videos from Bartow High School obtained by the police during their investigation.
Social Media Evidence:

Any records or documentation of the video posted by the student related to the incident.
Fee Waiver Request:
The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making the information publicly accessible. I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from its dissemination; if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance, and let me know if fees can be reduced or eliminated by removing specific items from the request, specifying which if so.

Please provide the requested records in electronic format, if available. If any records are withheld or redacted, kindly specify the reasons and the applicable exemptions under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within the timeframe prescribed by Florida Public Records Law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrest of Ezra Miller on March 28, 2022

communications.subject: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Public Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrest of Ezra Miller on March 28, 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request copies of all records related to the arrest of Ezra Miller on March 28, 2022, in Hilo, Hawaiʻi. This incident involved Mr. Miller allegedly causing a disturbance at a karaoke bar, leading to charges of disorderly conduct and harassment.

Specifically, I request:

1. **Incident and Arrest Reports:**
   - The complete incident report, arrest report, and any supplementary narratives authored by the responding officers concerning this event.
   - Any written statements provided by Mr. Miller during the incident or subsequent arrest process.

2. **Audio and Video Recordings:**
   - All available body-worn camera footage capturing the response, arrest, and any interactions with Mr. Miller.
   - Audio recordings of 911 calls, radio communications, and dispatch logs related to this incident.

3. **Booking and Detention Records:**
   - Mugshot and booking paperwork.
   - Any jail intake forms, property logs, or holding cell surveillance footage (if available).

4. **Internal Communications and Reports:**
   - Internal memos, emails, or communications within the Hawaiʻi Police Department pertaining to this incident.
   - Any reports or assessments generated as a result of this incident, including procedural reviews or evaluations.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format, if available, to facilitate prompt and efficient processing.

**Fee Disclosure and Request for Estimate:**
I acknowledge that this request is being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I am prepared to incur any applicable fees associated with the processing of this request. To manage costs effectively, I kindly ask that you provide an itemized estimate of the anticipated fees prior to fulfilling the request. If certain documents can be excluded to reduce costs, please inform me so that I can make an informed decision on how to proceed.

If any portion of this request is denied or if specific documents are withheld, please cite the specific statutory exemption that justifies the refusal. Additionally, if certain records are only partially exempt, I request that the non-exempt portions be disclosed after appropriate redaction, as stipulated by the Hawaiʻi Uniform Information Practices Act.

Please confirm receipt of this request and provide an estimated timeline for its fulfillment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrest of Nicholas Jones on May 5, 2019

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Records Pertaining to the Arrest of Nicholas Jones on May 5, 2019
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request copies of all records related to the arrest of Nicholas Jones on May 5, 2019, in St. Johns County, Florida. This incident involved Mr. Jones allegedly fleeing a traffic stop and subsequently calling 911 to report and boast about the incident, leading to his arrest.

1. **Incident and Arrest Reports:**
   - The complete incident report, arrest report, and any supplementary narratives authored by the responding deputies concerning this event.
   - Any written statements provided by Mr. Jones during the incident or subsequent arrest process.

2. **Audio and Video Recordings:**
   - All available dashcam and body-worn camera footage capturing the initial traffic stop, pursuit, arrest, and any interactions with Mr. Jones.
   - Audio recordings of 911 calls, including the call made by Mr. Jones, radio communications, and dispatch logs related to this incident.

3. **Evidence Documentation:**
   - Records detailing any evidence collected during the investigation, including descriptions of items found in Mr. Jones's vehicle at the time of arrest.
   - Inventory logs of any items seized from the vehicle or from Mr. Jones at the time of arrest.

4. **Internal Communications and Reports:**
   - Internal memos, emails, or communications within the St. Johns County Sheriff's Office pertaining to this incident.
   - Any reports or assessments generated as a result of this incident, including procedural reviews or evaluations.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format, if available, to facilitate prompt and efficient processing.

**Fee Disclosure and Request for Estimate:**
I acknowledge that this request is being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I am prepared to incur any applicable fees associated with the processing of this request. To manage costs effectively, I kindly ask that you provide an itemized estimate of the anticipated fees prior to fulfilling the request. If certain documents can be excluded to reduce costs, please inform me so that I can make an informed decision on how to proceed.

If any portion of this request is denied or if specific documents are withheld, please cite the specific statutory exemption that justifies the refusal. Additionally, if certain records are only partially exempt, I request that the non-exempt portions be disclosed after appropriate redaction, as stipulated by the Florida Public Records Act.

Please confirm receipt of this request and provide an estimated timeline for its fulfillment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.communication:

title: Tarrant County, Texas: Tim O'Hare communications on drag

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Tarrant County, Texas: Tim O'Hare communications on drag
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications sent or received by Tim O'Hare that mention any of the following terms: drag shows, drag, Executive Order, or Title IX. This request is limited to records generated on or after January 20, 2025.

2. Any communications between Tim O'Hare and any member of the University of Texas Board of Regents on or after March 10, 2025.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Request for Bodycam Footage – Mariangel Rodriguez-Vergara – Arrest on 03/12/2025

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Bodycam Footage – Mariangel Rodriguez-Vergara – Arrest on 03/12/2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage associated with the arrest of Mariangel Rodriguez-Vergara, which occurred on March 12, 2025, at 3013 E Las Olas Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL, 33316. The arrest was made by Officer Alexander Sederholm (ID #2127) of the Fort Lauderdale Police Department, and the incident took place at approximately 2:08 AM.

The charges filed include:

Illegal Use of Credit Card (More than 2 times in 6 months)
Fraudulent Misrepresentation of Self (Commit Personal ID – Misdemeanor)
Petit Theft (1st Degree)
Larceny – Lost or Delivered by Mistake (Credit Card)
The bodycam footage is requested for the purpose of understanding the events surrounding this arrest. I would appreciate your assistance in providing this footage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

mich

title: Arkansas Pine Bluff FRS

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Pine Bluff FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2016 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

title: CPD Murders 2002

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPD Murders 2002
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all homicides and involuntary manslaughters recorded in Cook County in 2002, including but not limited to the following fields:
- Case or report number,
- Date of death,
- Victim name,
- Victim birth year,
- Victim race,
- Victim sex, 
- Location of incident,
- Cause of death,
- Weapon used, if applicable,
- Case status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a freelance reporter for Medill News and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled in the form of CSV or Excel file, and electronically by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
